description: On March 15, it was announced that to fight incorrect information, Ukraine’s health ministry has partnered with Facebook, which has 14 million users in the country. The social network will push updates from verified sources such as the ministry website and the government coronavirus information website, covid19.com.ua.

On March 31, the Anti-Monopoly Committee of Ukraine bans advertisements of any medications as treatment for the coronavirus as such ads are deceptive. Pharmaceutical companies, advertising agencies and media companies that violate the law will be fined up to 5% of their annual revenues.

description: On 25 March, the Government introduced a 30-day emergency regime across Ukraine planned to end on 24 April 2020.

Due to the significant spread of COVID-19 in certain areas, all administrative-territorial units in Ukraine are classified as regions with a red level of epidemic danger. Among those are: Horodenkiv and Kosiv districts of Ivano-Frankivsk region, Sambir city of Lviv region, Bilyaivka city of Odessa region, Dubno city, Kostopil and Rivne districts of Rivne region, Kitsman district of Chernivtsi region. This decision was made by the Central Commission for Technogenic and Environmental Safety and Emergencies at a meeting on August 13. Restrictions will apply from August 17.
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Starting from March 12, only 49 out of 219 border crossing checkpoints will operate in Ukraine

All scheduled commercial international passenger services, including flights, trains and passenger buses to and from Ukraine are currently suspended.  Airlines, including Ukraine International Airlines, have conducted repatriation flights on a rolling basis, with unpredictable schedules. All foreigners without residence permits are barred from entering Ukraine.
target_who_what: All Foreign Nationals (Foreign Residents + Foreign Travelers)

description: As of March 15, all foreigners without residence permits were barred from entering Ukraine. The ban will last till March 29.
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: As of April 7, Ukraine's state border will be allowed to cross only by motor vehicles and exceptionally through 19 checkpoints. This is envisaged by the amendments made to Resolution of the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine No. 288-<U+0440> “On the temporary closure of some border crossing points and border checkpoints and termination of pedestrian traffic in those checkpoints”.

Starting from March 12, only 49 out of 219 border crossing checkpoints will operate in Ukraine. However, starting March 17, Ukraine's state border will be allowed to cross only by motor vehicles and exceptionally through 19 checkpoints.

On April 15 the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine has supported the closure of another 10 crossing points for motor vehicles on border in order to increase the safety level to abide by quarantine restrictions. "It is proposed to close the following checkpoints "Kostely", "Smilnytsia", "Hrushiv", "Ugryniv", "Solotvyno", "Kalmintsi", "Bronnytsia", "Sokyryany", "Novi Trojany" and "Palanka". These are checkpoints for automobile and sometimes pedestrian traffic," the Minister added.

As of April 7, Ukraine's state border will be allowed to cross only by motor vehicles and exceptionally through 19 checkpoints. However, on Apil 15 it was announced that Ukraine has supported the closure of another 10 crossing points for motor vehicles on the border

On May 6, the Ukrainian Government adopted a decision resuming the operation of checkpoints across the state border Rava-Ruska for motor communication and Skadovsk Sea Commercial Port for marine communication
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: The Ukrainian Government supported a proposal on the opening of Shehyni border checkpoint. The decision will take effect from the moment of its publication
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: In accordance with the requirements of the Resolution of the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine No. 477 of June 12, 2020, the operation of 15 checkpoints for air communication has been resumed. Airports allowed entry for foreigners who are not citizens of countries with a high COVID-19 morbidity rate and have not been on the territory of such states for the past 14 days.

By a decision of the KCSA  (Kyiv City State Administration) commission, the respective departments were instructed to provide incoming sanitary control in the premises of children's, sports, social, cultural and specialized institutions. Povoroznyk stressed that this decision of the KCSA was binding. He also explained that this decision did not limit the work of public authorities, but they should monitor the temperature of their employees.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description:
In Ukraine, the Cabinet of Ministers has ordered State Institution "Kyiv City Laboratory Center of the Ministry of Health of Ukraine", Department of Health of the executive body of the Kyiv City Council (KCSA), district state administrations in Kyiv, Main Directorate of the National Police of Ukraine in Kyiv to organize joint work on timely detection, examination and isolation of persons who have been in contact with patients in whom the case of COVID-19 has been laboratory confirmed
Responsible: Chumak SP, Ginzburg VG, heads of districts in the city, Kyiv state administrations, Kryshchenko AE
enforcer: National Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
According to a resolution initiated by Ukraine's Minister of Health adopted at a government meeting on March 25, health facilities have the right to conduct a mandatory medical examination of people who have symptoms of COVID-19 or who have been in contact with people who are diagnosed with COVID-19 if these individuals refuse to be examined voluntarily. 
The Health Ministry will develop and approve the procedure for mandatory hospitalization of people who are diagnosed (or suspected) of COVID-19, and who evade treatment, examination and quarantine (self-isolation) on a voluntary basis, as well as the mandatory self-isolation of people who are diagnosed (or suspected) COVID-19 and their contact persons.

Starting on April 6, all Ukrainians who arrived in the country from abroad since March 17 and signed documents upon their arrival promising to self-isolate for 14 days will receive a link to install the Diy Vdoma app. Those infected who are being treated at home will also receive the link. The app monitors whether people are self-isolating and using it will be voluntary for now.
type_sub_cat: A person’s absolute (e.g. GPS) location over time

Funds have been directed to curbing the spread of COVID-19.

At a government session on May 6, the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine has allocated UAH 3 billion 132 million to fight coronavirus. The funding will be transferred to the following directions: providing personal protective equipment for healthcare facilities and emergency medical care departments; purchase of goods (works, services) necessary to ensure preparedness and response to COVID-19 outbreaks; salaries of medical and other personnel of laboratory centers of the Ministry of Health of Ukraine for March - June 2020.

description: At a government meeting on May 27, the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine supported the initiative of the Ministry of Health to extend the list of healthcare facilities that treat patients with COVID-19. According to the data included in the resolution, the list of medical institutions was expanded from 339 to 449 institutions.

Since March 17 the Ukrainian government will give extra payments to employees of medical institutions and other individuals who work to stop the spread of the coronavirus. Their salary can up to double while the country is fighting the virus. Starting July 1, a new increase in salaries initiated by the Ministry of Health of Ukraine will amount to additional 50%.

At a Government session on July 8, the Ukrainian government has adopted a resolution on the allocation of additional funds from the Coronavirus Response Fund for the purchase of equipment for the emergency departments of base hospitals.

According to the decision of the Commission on Technogenic and Environmental Safety and Emergencies in seven regions of Ukraine additional hospitals will engage in providing medical care to patients with coronavirus disease. The regions are the city of Kyiv, Vinnytsia, Volyn, Zakarpattia, Ivano-Frankivsk, Ternopil and Rivne regions

description: On November 3, the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine allocated UAH 1.259 billion to expand the testing process. In particular, UAH 1 billion will be transferred for the purchase of Antibody ELISA tests for SARS-CoV-2 to allow performing plus 1 million tests per month. Almost UAH 213 million will be transferred for the development of laboratory facilities in communal facilities, in order to increase PCR testing in hospitals.

On November 3, the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine allocated UAH 1.259 billion to expand the testing process. In particular, UAH 1 billion will be transferred for the purchase of Antibody ELISA tests for SARS-CoV-2 to allow performing plus 1 million tests per month. Almost UAH 213 million will be transferred for the development of laboratory facilities in communal facilities, in order to increase PCR testing in hospitals.

The Department of Transport Infrastructure of the executive body of the Kyiv City Council (Kyiv City State Administration) to ensure the production and issuance of enterprises, institutions, organizations that ensure the viability of the city of Kyiv, a special ticket for transportation of their employees in urban land transport (tram, trolleybus, bus)
Responsible: Osipov VO
From March 23, to the municipal enterprise "Kyivpastrans", which carries out transportation of passengers by land transport to provide transportation on separately defined routes only to those persons who have the appropriate special tickets, identity cards and means of individual protection according to the concluded agreements with the enterprises, establishments, the organizations providing vital activity of the city of Kyiv

description: On March 16, the President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy recommended that all people stay home, except for the need to buy food or pharmaceuticals. This is especially related to citizens over the age of 60 who are at risk.

At the beginning of April, the Ukrainian government has drafted a resolution containing clauses on the ultimate self-isolation of elderly citizens over 60 years old with chronic diseases, diabetes, or cardiovascular diseases.
In Ukraine, from April 6, children under 14 are restricted from being in public places without an accompanying adult
On June 3, it was announced that in Ukraine people over 60 are no longer obliged to comply with self-isolation orders.

On March 16, it was announced that President Zelensky creates a coordination council to combat the spread of the coronavirus in Ukraine. It consists of a number of ministers, the head of the border guard service, the General Staff and National Security and Defense Council.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: On March 14, the Government commissioned the Ministry of Infrastructure, together with the Ministry of Health, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Ministry of Internal Affairs, to provide emergency evacuation of Ukrainian citizens from the Italian Republic that reports the highest number of acute respiratory disease COVID-19 cases

description:
"The Ukrainian parliament has passed new laws aimed at mitigating the effects of novel coronavirus. 
Those who fail to follow the rules and are proven guilty will face up to three years in prison. If these actions cause death or other grave consequences, individuals can be sentenced to five-seven years in prison.
The law also introduces punishment for violation of quarantine, sanitary and hygienic rules and anti-epidemic measures. Those who violate the restrictions will face fines from Hr 17,000 ($630) to 51,000 ($1,890), six months of arrest, or up to three years in prison."
type_text: For violation of quarantine rules, a fine is envisaged. And if one violates sanitary rules and regulations for the prevention of infectious diseases, he/she may be brought to criminal responsibility.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: The Foreign Ministry launched a program called “Zahyst” (“Protection”) to help Ukrainians trapped abroad. Ukraine’s embassies and consulates around the world will inform them about possible ways to return home and will help resolve visa issues. They will coordinate with local authorities, law enforcement, and businesses to help Ukrainians find places to stay and will help protect their rights.
type_text: Launching a special program to help Ukrainian citizens return home from abroad

description: Ukraine’s National Online School project: 11 different TV channels started broadcasting lessons for schoolchildren from fifth to eleventh grade. The lessons will also be available on the official web pages of the Ministry of Education and Science of Ukraine on Facebook and YouTube.
type_text: The Ukrainian Government launched an online and TV school project in which 11 TV channels agreed on broadcasting school lessons in all subjects from first to eleventh grade. The lessons can also be streamed via YouTube and Facebook

description: According to the Ukrainian Minister of Health, the Government's Resolution approves the Procedure for carrying out anti-epidemic measures related to the self-isolation of a person, namely: registering of persons who are on self-isolation in the "Diia" ("Action") application developed to the Ministry of Digital Transformation.
type_text: registering people who are on self-isolation to a specialized application called "Action"

description: Answers on "FAQ on COVID-19 – illness, triggered by the coronavirus" collected on an officiail website launched by the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine and the National Ministry of Health. Additionally, a channel on Telegram was launched to provide recent information on the national situation concerning COVID-19.

On March 29, the Ministry of Health rolls out an interactive dashboard of 240 hospitals prepared to treat severe coronavirus patients. Dashboard contains information on the place of hospitalization and a level of institutions for hospitalization of patients with COVID-19. Relevant hospitals have been selected and approved by the heads of regions and regional departments of health's recommended NCSU in conjunction with the MOH.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: To help Kyivans live through the quarantine and decrease the high level of psychological stress it causes, Klitschko advised visiting an online platform for emotional support launched by the Kyiv City Council two days ago, on April 8.

An online platform containing information on the use of medicines for patients with COVID-19 has been launched in Ukraine. Created by the State Expert Center (SEC) of the Ministry of Health, the resource is intended to inform citizens and doctors about the drugs used in the treatment of coronavirus disease.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: The Ukrainian government has extended the quarantine regime through April 24. All non-essential city services are closed except grocery stores, pharmacies, banks, and gas stations. In Kyiv, grocery stores and pharmacies are limited to one customer per 10 square meters and they may require patrons to wear masks. Grocery stores are currently well-supplied, but you should expect lines and delays.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Ukrainian government has supported new restrictions that oblige all those arriving in Ukraine from abroad to undergo a 14-day quarantine under thorough medical supervision, Deputy Health Minister of Ukraine Viktor Lyashko said during a March 30 online briefing. And following new restrictive measures put in place on March 29, all citizens coming to the country this way will be placed in quarantine for 14 days. They will have to stay on the premises chosen by state oblast administrations, including in regional hotels and sanatoria.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: In Ukraine, starting March 17 until April 3, all cultural, shopping, and entertainment centers, restaurants, cafés, and fitness centers will close. Restaurants and cafés can continue to cook food, which can be ordered from home. All public authorities, healthcare facilities, and law enforcement agencies will operate as normal. Grocery stores, gas stations, pharmacies, banking institutions, and insurance companies will also continue to provide service nationwide.

description: In Ukraine, starting March 17 until April 3, all cultural, shopping, and entertainment centers, restaurants, cafés, and fitness centers will close. Restaurants and cafés can continue to cook food, which can be ordered from home. All public authorities, healthcare facilities, and law enforcement agencies will operate as normal. Grocery stores, gas stations, pharmacies, banking institutions, and insurance companies will also continue to provide service nationwide.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Restaurants") is closed/locked down

description: In Ukraine, from March 12 till April 3, access to the administrative buildings and offices of the Verkhovna Rada will be limited for everyone except deputies, employees of the Office of the Verkhovna Rada, assistant-consultants of deputies of Ukraine, who work under a fixed-term contract on a permanent basis. As a result, personal reception of citizens in the administrative buildings of the Verkhovna Rada was also suspended till April 3.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Regulations on government meetings (including e.g. suspension of parliament)
institution_status: This service is no longer provided by the government

description: In Ukraine gatherings of more than ten people are prohibited until May 11
In Ukraine, public gatherings remain to be prohibited until May 22
In Ukraine, from March 12 to April 3 gatherings of 200 people are banned

The government has banned gatherings larger than 10 people, including cultural, entertainment, sports, social, religious, advertising, and sporting events. Use of playgrounds and sports grounds is prohibited. Subways in Kyiv, Dnipro and Kharkiv are closed.  All other city transport, including buses and trams, may carry no more than 10 passengers at one time. City transport in Kyiv is limited to essential personnel with passes only.
In Ukraine, from April 1, the movement of more than two people is prohibited with the exception for emergencies or for accompanying children
Ukraine has imposed travel restrictions, in its capital Kyiv, allowing no more than 10 people to travel on buses and trams from March 18 to April 3
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on ridership of subways and trams

description: Ukraine has imposed travel restrictions, in its capital Kyiv, allowing no more than 10 people to travel on buses and trams from March 18 to April 3

In Ukraine, from March 18 all intercity and interregional rail, bus, metro, and air transportation services will be suspended. Urban transportation is allowed in minibuses and taxis for up to ten people and up to 20 people in trolleybuses, buses, and tram cars
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on  private vehicles in public circulation

In Ukraine, from March 18, until further notice, passenger transportation by rail is terminated in all types of internal connections (suburban, urban, regional and long-distance)
Starting March 25, in Kyiv, people must maintain a distance of no more than one person per 10 square meters in supermarkets and pharmacies, the Kyiv city council announced in a statement on March 21
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart

description: In Ukraine, from April individuals are required to wear masks in public places
